title: Ping Spikes in 7.3
body:
**Please up-vote and comment if you have had similar ping spikes since 7.3 update.**


**OS:** Windows 10
**Patch: **7.3
**Firewall/Antivirus:** Avira
**Connection: **Wireless 5GHz network

**Issue Occurrence:** 100% in every game mode (including tutorials)

**Issue Overview:** Since updating to the 7.3 patch, I have been experiencing massive lag spikes in game. The FPS stays consistently in the hundreds but once every few minutes, the MS will spike from 25-30 all the way to 600 or more. It also seems to happen when there is a lot going on in the game play (engaging in team fights as opposed to farming minions).  The usual visual cues happen: freezing, champions gliding, directing a champ one direction but getting no response...etc.  I have been playing the game on the same internet connection for the last two years, first on Mac OS, then recently built a new computer and now play on Windows. I have been playing on this machine since the tail end of season 6 all the way through the most recent patch. I have never had to change firewall permissions or anything like that to update or play the game. I have never even once experienced a lag spike before this patch in fact.

**Attempted Fixes:**I completed the connection troubleshooting page and used the Hextech fixing tool - but to no avail. The tool did confirm high ping during my previous game, but when it tested the ping again it was very low. Not sure where to go from here... Any help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body: Is good to know I am not alone.
Same. Thought it was me until I did everything on my side. Just waiting on Rito to do something about it before I play again.
you and me both brother
Same. At first I thought my NEW Pc was having problems, as this has never happened before i logged on today. However my bro logged on and the same thing was happening to him.

Also I would ditto the O.P - I have a Windows 10 machine and since patch 7.3 have been getting massive ping spikes every so often. Can affirm OP that this issue seems to be beyond just one person. Oddly enough this issue doesnt happen on my macbook air, only my newly built and powerful PC. No lag on the Mac only on the PC.

Oh hey, I saw your reply on that other thread. I decided to reply here, to keep all your info and our troubleshooting steps consolidated here. Since you've already completed the connection guide and listed all your information here in a beautiful and easy to read format, I think we can move forward with troubleshooting. Thanks btw, this post was super easy to read and basically gives me all the context I could ever want from a tech issue post. :)

We'll need to take a look at your network routing to figure out if there are issues somewhere between your PC and our servers. Since you're on a wireless connection now, I'd like you to temporarily swap over to a wired connection (if possible) so we can ensure the test results won't be skewed by wireless networking conditions. If you are unable to temporarily move off wireless, that's okay, but it would be preferred. I'd like you to use a networking app called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to grab this log. After loading up the application, just plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After the trace has been able to run for 5 minutes or longer, you can go ahead and export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you ran into any issues with this. ^.^

Thanks for the reply! I actually used to work in a customer support role and I know context is half the battle! In any case, I ran the trace for a little over 5 min. Usually, in game, I would've had at least one "event" in that time frame. Below are the results...

It doesn't look like your traceroute shows the huge latency spikes you mentioned in your OP, but it definitely looks like your latency isn't great to your Gateway (spikes up to **190ms**). Can you give your FiOS Gateway a quick reboot (unplug for 30 sec) and run another trace when you experience the symptoms in a custom match? I recommend a custom match because it prevents you from being impacted during a real match and doesn't put others behind if you happen to disconnect. ^.^

Hey Targons,

So i went back to the new client after updating to 7.4 and am still seeing the lag spikes. I reset the router and everything, and also ran the WinMTR while playing an ARAM where I experienced lag spikes. Just anecdotally, I have been seeing more people in chat report the same type of incidents since the recent updates. Below is my latest run with Win MTR. Thanks so much for your support.

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |
|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
|   FIOS_Quantum_Gateway.fios-router.home -    0 | 1505 | 1505 |    0 |    8 |  162 |    1 |
|lo0-100.PHLAPA-VFTTP-349.verizon-gni.net -    1 | 1497 | 1495 |    1 |   13 | 1209 |    3 |
|     B3349.PHLAPA-LCR-21.verizon-gni.net -    1 | 1501 | 1500 |    1 |   14 |  986 |    5 |
|                   No response from host -  100 |  302 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |
|                   No response from host -  100 |  302 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |
|               0.ae9.GW11.IAD8.ALTER.NET -    1 | 1501 | 1500 |    6 |   18 | 1052 |   11 |
|         riotgames-gw.customer.alter.net -    0 | 1505 | 1505 |    6 |   18 |  594 |    7 |
|                          104.160.137.35 -    1 | 1501 | 1500 |    7 |   21 |  756 |    8 |
|          ae35-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -    1 | 1501 | 1500 |   21 |   35 |  491 |   39 |
|                           104.160.131.1 -    0 | 1505 | 1505 |   22 |   34 |  615 |   27 |
|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|
   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

This traceroute shows that your connection begins *heavily spiking* in latency on the first hop outside of your home network (lo0-100.PHLAPA-VFTTP-349.verizon-gni.net). I think at this point, it would be a good idea to escalate this to your ISP's tier 2 support. Providing them with this traceroute should be more than enough data to help them launch an investigation and resolve this with you.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
Thanks so much for the help! I'll keep this forum updated.

Can you give your FiOS Gateway a quick reboot (unplug for 30 sec) and run another trace when you experience the symptoms in a custom match? I recommend a custom match because it prevents you from being impacted during a real match and doesn't put others behind if you happen to disconnect. ^.^

pretty sure we all have reset our routers/modems and the issue continues to persist. given that more and more people are responding to this post dont you think this may be an issue beyond resetting our internet?

Sure - I should have mentioned I am UNABLE to switch to a wired connection unfortunately. So the above read is based on a wireless connection.  I tried switching to the old client and played a few custom games there and even tried a ranked, and actually did not experience the same lag spikes at all - even once. Today i switched back to the new client, tried custom, the sandbox mode, and another ranked and also did not experience any lag spikes whatsoever. I will continue to test over the next few days, and if it pops up again, I will run another trace and post here. Fingers crossed, but for now the issue seems to have resolved itself...
Lucky you! I am still getting the spikes :(

Having the same issue since patch 7.3. Ping will go from 50 to 300 almost 100 times every game. Almost unplayable at this point. I have Bell Aliant Internet. Also didn't happen at all before the new patch. had a steady 50.
Hope we can get a riot response for this because it seems to be a consistent for all of us with very similar Windows 10 PC set ups and the issue only starting after patch 7.3

Here's my stuff, same problem as everyone else... But, I run on Comcast in Colorado
OS: Windows 7
Patch: 7.3
Firewall/Antivirus: Bitdefender, supplemented with Malwarebytes when I'm bored
Connection: Wireless 5GHz network also tested it over Ethernet

Fixes tried: Reset router to factory and re-initialized it with full port forewarding
                   - Hextech Repair Tool
                   - Running league as admin
                   - Using Cellphone as wifi hotspot (it's actually not bad when it's my internet's problem)
                   - Running the UC Berkley tool from the support page (everything came up green except 2 things which were labeled minor)
                   - Sweet talking to computer
                   - Yelling at computer
                   - Prayer

Nothing seems to have fixed it. After running the HRT, the spikes got worse and sit at an average of 500+ms of ping. Ran WinMTR for about 1/2 an hour while I made a cake. We'll see how the cake turns out {{champion:223}}

I saw where Targon told someone to run malwarebytes in another thread so i tried that. Found a trojan and it fixed all my issues.If you haven't done that you may want to try it.

I just switched over to Bell and noticed the same problem, it fluctuates and it is very unstable!!! It goes from 23ms to 300ms lagging like crazy. Can anyone tell me if the problem is solved or everybody just use Ethernet or switch over to some other service providers?

Thanks
In my normal game a few minutes ago my ping starts out at 43ms, about 4-5 minutes into the game it would jump up to 200-600ms, it even went up to 1000-2000ms when team fights happen.

I'm having some spikes as well. Normally I have very minimal lag, sitting between 23-60 or so ms, but then apparently during fights it can jump in the hundreds and sometimes thousands. I had mine spike to over 7k, and this kind of issue happened two games in a row. Tried restarting my router, no significant improvement.
I have had this issue since 7.4 patch. Had ping spikes as high as 15k! Never had a problem before this patch.
